definitions: person who attempts to bring two unmarried people together for potential romantic relationship
examples: The matchmaker introduced them at a charity event last year
My grandmother worked as a professional matchmaker in her community

definitions: practice or business of bringing people together for potential romantic relationships or marriage
examples: Online matchmaking has become increasingly popular in recent years
Her family business specialized in matchmaking for professionals

definitions: pairing of opponents in sports or competition to determine relative strength
examples: Tonight's matchup features two undefeated teams in the playoffs
The matchup between these rivals always draws huge crowds

definitions: informal British term for mother often used in upper class speech
examples: The old boy mentioned his mater lived in the countryside
He received a letter from his mater during boarding school

definitions: philosophical theory that physical matter is the only reality
tendency to value material possessions and physical comfort above spiritual values
examples: The philosopher argued against materialism in his latest book
Scientific materialism dominated nineteenth century intellectual thought
Their materialism prevented them from appreciating life's simple pleasures
Modern society often criticizes excessive materialism and consumerism

definitions: person who values material possessions and physical comfort above spiritual matters
person who believes that physical matter is the only reality
examples: Critics called him a materialist obsessed with wealth and status
She abandoned her materialist lifestyle for spiritual pursuits
The materialist argued that consciousness emerges from brain activity
Famous materialists include Marx and other philosophical thinkers

definitions: quality or state of being composed of physical matter rather than spiritual
significance or relevance of information especially in legal or financial contexts
examples: The materiality of objects contrasts with abstract concepts and ideas
Artists explore the materiality of paint and canvas texture
The auditor questioned the materiality of the accounting discrepancy
Courts must determine the materiality of evidence before admission

definitions: military equipment and supplies including weapons vehicles and ammunition used in warfare
examples: The army transported materiel to the forward operating base
Military materiel must be carefully maintained and inventoried regularly

definitions: state of being a mother or the period during pregnancy and shortly after childbirth
examples: She took maternity leave three weeks before her due date
The hospital opened a new maternity ward last month

definitions: person who studies or has expert knowledge of mathematics as their profession
examples: The mathematician solved the complex equation in minutes
Famous mathematicians have contributed to scientific breakthroughs throughout history

definitions: theatrical or cinema performance taking place in the afternoon rather than evening
examples: We bought tickets for the Saturday matinee at half price
The matinee performance attracts families with young children

definitions: process by which animals come together to reproduce and produce offspring
examples: Scientists observed the mating behavior of endangered birds
The mating season brings dramatic changes in animal behavior

definitions: woman who rules or dominates a family group or social organization
examples: The matriarch made all important decisions for the extended family
Everyone respected the wisdom of the clan's elderly matriarch

definitions: final year of high school or the qualification examination in some educational systems
examples: She studied hard to pass her matric exams with distinction
The matric results determine university admission in many countries

definitions: formal process of entering or being enrolled in a college or university
examples: Matriculation ceremonies welcome new students to the university each fall
The matriculation requirements include transcripts and standardized test scores

definitions: state of being married or the ceremony and institution of marriage
examples: They entered into holy matrimony at the cathedral last spring
The couple celebrated fifty years of matrimony with their children

definitions: rectangular array of numbers or symbols arranged in rows and columns
surrounding substance or environment within which something develops or is contained
examples: The mathematician multiplied the two matrices to solve the equation
Computer graphics use matrix transformations for rendering 3D objects
The fossil was embedded in a matrix of sedimentary rock
Corporate culture forms the matrix within which employees operate

definitions: mature married woman especially one with dignity and social position
woman in charge of nursing staff or domestic arrangements in institution
examples: The society matron hosted charity events throughout the year
Victorian matrons maintained strict social standards and decorum
The matron supervised all nurses in the hospital ward
Students reported to the matron when feeling unwell

definitions: surface finish that is dull and non-reflective without shine or gloss
examples: The photographer preferred matt prints for the exhibition display
They chose matt paint for the bedroom walls

definitions: dull or flat finish on a surface lacking shine or glossiness
examples: She applied matte lipstick for a modern sophisticated look
The matte screen protector reduces glare on sunny days

definitions: coarse woven material used as floor covering or for packing and protection
examples: They placed rubber matting in the gym for safety
The entrance featured natural fiber matting to trap dirt

definitions: process of becoming mature or fully developed physically emotionally or intellectually
examples: The maturation of wine requires careful temperature control over years
Adolescent brain maturation continues into the early twenties

definitions: state of being fully developed physically emotionally or mentally
date when a financial obligation becomes due for payment
examples: Her emotional maturity impressed everyone at the interview
The fruit reached maturity after three months on the vine
The bond reaches maturity in ten years from purchase
Investment maturity dates determine when principal is repaid

definitions: heavy hammer with wedge-shaped head used for splitting wood or driving stakes
examples: He swung the maul to split the oak logs
The fence installer used a maul to drive posts

definitions: large stately building housing tomb or burial chamber often elaborately decorated
examples: The family mausoleum stood in the oldest section of cemetery
Ancient mausoleums reveal much about past burial customs

definitions: pale purple color with grayish or pinkish tint named after mallow flower
examples: She decorated the nursery in soft mauve and cream tones
The mauve dress complemented her fair complexion perfectly

definitions: person with expert knowledge or understanding in particular field who seeks to share it
examples: The fashion maven advised celebrities on their red carpet looks
Local food mavens recommended the best restaurants in town

definitions: person who thinks and acts independently refusing to conform to group
unbranded calf or yearling found on open range
examples: The maverick entrepreneur disrupted the entire industry with innovations
Political mavericks often challenge their own party's positions
Cowboys rounded up mavericks during the annual cattle drive
Ranchers disputed ownership of mavericks found on shared grazing land

definitions: stomach of an animal or the throat and jaws of voracious creature
examples: The whale opened its enormous maw to filter feed
Food disappeared into the hungry dog's maw within seconds

definitions: informal term for maximum or the highest amount or degree possible
examples: The volume was turned up to the max during the party
She pushed her abilities to the max during training

definitions: dress skirt or coat with hemline reaching to the ankles
examples: She wore a flowing maxi dress to the beach wedding
Maxi skirts became popular fashion statements in the seventies

definitions: short pithy statement expressing general truth or rule of conduct
examples: The ancient maxim 'know thyself' still guides philosophical thinking
Business maxims often oversimplify complex management situations

definitions: process or act of making something as large or great as possible
examples: Profit maximization drives many corporate decisions and strategies
The software handles resource maximization for optimal performance

definitions: small spring flowering plant with fragrant pink or white flowers
name of ship that brought Pilgrims to America in 1620
examples: Mayflowers bloomed early in the woodland clearing this year
Children picked mayflowers for their mother's birthday bouquet
The Mayflower voyage lasted sixty-six days across the Atlantic
Mayflower descendants trace ancestry to the original passengers

definitions: delicate insect with transparent wings that lives only one or two days as adult
examples: Mayflies emerged from the river in massive swarms at dusk
Fishermen use mayfly imitations as effective fishing lures

definitions: violent or damaging disorder and confusion causing disruption or destruction
examples: The storm caused mayhem throughout the coastal region overnight
Holiday shopping creates mayhem at popular retail stores

definitions: informal shortened term for mayonnaise condiment
examples: She asked for extra mayo on her sandwich
The recipe calls for two tablespoons of mayo

definitions: thick creamy sauce made from egg yolks oil and vinegar or lemon juice
examples: Homemade mayonnaise tastes better than store-bought versions
The potato salad recipe requires one cup of mayonnaise

definitions: office or position of mayor or the period during which someone serves as mayor
examples: His mayoralty focused on improving public transportation and housing
The mayoralty election attracted several qualified candidates this year

definitions: tall wooden pole decorated with ribbons around which people dance during May Day celebrations
examples: Children danced around the maypole at the spring festival
The village erected a traditional maypole in the town square

definitions: complex network of paths or passages designed to puzzle those trying to find way through
examples: The corn maze attracted thousands of visitors each autumn
She felt lost in the maze of hospital corridors

definitions: lively Polish dance in triple time or the music composed for such dancing
examples: The orchestra performed a spirited mazurka by Chopin
Dancers whirled across the floor to the mazurka rhythm

definitions: abbreviation for microgram a unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram
examples: The vitamin supplement contains 400 mcg of folic acid
Doctors prescribed medication measured in mcg for precise dosing

definitions: alcoholic beverage made by fermenting honey with water sometimes with spices
archaic or poetic term for meadow
examples: Vikings celebrated victories by drinking mead from ceremonial horns
The brewery specializes in crafting traditional mead recipes
Sheep grazed peacefully in the verdant mead below
Poets wrote of lovers meeting in flowery meads

definitions: piece of grassland especially one used for hay or grazing animals
examples: Wildflowers bloomed throughout the meadow in early summer
Cattle grazed in the meadow beside the stream

definitions: winding curve or bend of a river or path that follows indirect course
examples: The river's meander created a perfect spot for fishing
Garden paths often include meanders for visual interest
